name: TheAtlantic
text: "New Orleans Mayor Mitch Landrieu gave the whole country a serious lesson in how Americans should contemplate their war dead, indeed their broader past, in this divided and quarrelsome nation," David Blight writes. https://t.co/Stk4XsALJt

name: TheAtlantic
text: RT @sarahzhang: I wrote about COVID-19 vaccine skepticism, which already exists and which names like "Operation Warp Speed" really do not help https://t.co/blgfGLR7Vd

name: TheAtlantic
text: RT @TheAtlArchives: Joan of Arc was burned at the stake 589 years ago this week. In an 1884 poem, Helen Gray Cone recalled the French heroine's lost girlhood: https://t.co/SC4D5b7aNT https://t.co/R9KaTDpcjl

name: TheAtlantic
text: "Donald Trump doesn’t merely want to criticize his opponents; he takes a depraved delight in inflicting pain on others, even if there’s collateral damage in the process, as is the case with the Klausutis family," @Peter_Wehner writes: https://t.co/vabNcjJWxT

name: TheAtlantic
text: "The insect is relentless in its search for hosts. Those who fight it must be relentless too." Sarah Zhang on the quietly audacious project that changed the lives of cattle, deer, and humans throughout North and Central America: https://t.co/qiiU3JrkZG

name: TheAtlantic
text: "We push away from what we know." How the work ethic of artists syncs with this moment of pandemic: https://t.co/OehIc8k1BU

name: TheAtlantic
text: "'Make America Great Again' was a promise; “Keep America Great' was a declaration of victory. 'Transition to Greatness' is a confession of failure, a corporate-style euphemism that tries to spin a collapse as a success," writes @GrahamDavidA: https://t.co/wVTVQzHQKe

name: TheAtlantic
text: Schools, restaurants, workplaces, and shops have installed plexiglass shields and plastic curtains, tents, and screens as measures to prevent the spread of COVID-19, leading to a new social landscape of clear-plastic barriers. https://t.co/VZAZOMvnMk

name: TheAtlantic
text: "A pardon would have been simple, wholly and unambiguously within Trump’s authority, and decisive, ending the case with a stroke of the presidential pen," @qjurecic and @benjaminwittes write: https://t.co/3rjt1b4Svh
